content.text: Let me search for information about Behavior Frontiers and its relationship with NexPhase Capital.

input.query: Behavior Frontiers NexPhase Capital portfolio company investment acquisition status

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Behavior Frontiers was acquired by NexPhase Capital on May 5, 2025; terms were not disclosed, and the existing leadership team continues to lead the company under NexPhase’s ownership.[3][5]

Key details
- Buyer: **NexPhase Capital (NPC)**, a lower middle‑market private equity firm focused on healthcare, software, and consumer sectors.[3][5]  
- Target: **Behavior Frontiers**, a national ABA therapy provider founded in 2004 by CEO Helen Mader.[3][5]  
- Deal type/status: **Acquisition/portfolio company investment**; transaction closed/announced May 5, 2025; financial terms undisclosed.[3][5][4]  
- Prior sponsor: **Lorient Capital** previously backed Behavior Frontiers; reports did not clarify whether Lorient retains any stake post‑transaction.[2]  
- Operations at close: Behavior Frontiers operated **26 centers** plus home‑based care across **12 states**, supported by proprietary practice‑management software **PrioraCare**.[3][5]  
- Post‑deal governance/ops: NexPhase Operating Partners **Barbara Hill** and **John Kill** to work closely with the company; existing executive team remains in place.[2][3]

Sources and announcements
- Behavior Frontiers press release announcing sale to NexPhase (May 5, 2025).[1]  
- NexPhase press release and firm site confirming the acquisition and strategic support (May 5, 2025).[3][5]  
- Industry coverage summarizing the deal, prior sponsor, and undisclosed terms (May 5, 2025).[2]  
- Legal deal tracker noting NexPhase’s typical equity investment range ($40M–$150M) and undisclosed terms for this transaction (May 13, 2025).[4]

Sources:
1. https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/behavior-frontiers-announces-sale-to-nexphase-capital-302445660.html
2. https://bhbusiness.com/2025/05/05/national-autism-therapy-provider-behavior-frontiers-sells-to-nexphase-capital/
3. https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/nexphase-announces-acquisition-of-behavior-frontiers-302445786.html
4. https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/healthcare-life-sciences-private-equity-6786343/
5. https://www.nexphase.com/nexphase-announces-acquisition-of-behavior-frontiers/


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}

input.query: Behavior Frontiers employee count headcount workforce size number of employees 2024

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "The most recent third-party estimates put Behavior Frontiers’ 2024–2025 headcount in the roughly 1,200–1,600 range, with Growjo listing 1,557 employees as of May 12, 2025, and Highperformr listing 1,225 employees (undated, reflecting 2024-era data).[1][3] Employer-profile sites broadly categorize the company size as 1,001–5,000 employees, which is consistent with those estimates but less precise.[2][4]

Details and context
- Growjo: lists Behavior Frontiers at 1,557 employees and notes 32% employee growth in the prior year (snapshot dated May 12, 2025). This suggests a workforce in the mid‑1,000s around late 2024 to early 2025.[1]
- Highperformr: shows “Total employees 1225” for Behavior Frontiers, which appears to reflect an earlier or more conservative 2024-era count.[3]
- Indeed company profiles: categorize Behavior Frontiers in the 1,001–5,000 employee band, offering a range rather than a point estimate.[2][4]
- Company site: an older About page claims “over 2100 employees,” but the page appears to be dated and likely predates recent third‑party snapshots; treat it cautiously for 2024 headcount specifics.[5]

Bottom line
- Best point estimate for 2024: approximately 1,200–1,600 employees, with the most specific figure near 1,500 by early 2025.[1][3]
- Range corroboration: employer-profile ranges align with a 1k–5k categorization but aren’t exact.[2][4]

Sources:
1. https://growjo.com/company/Behavior_Frontiers
2. https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Behavior-Frontiers
3. https://highperformr.ai/company/behavior-frontiers
4. https://www.indeed.com/companies/compare/Behavior-Frontiers-vs-Kyo-1-e2d96f996550d16a-9226a1ae4cd7fbeb
5. https://www.behaviorfrontiers.com/about-us-main


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"

  ],

}

input.query: Empower Community Care NexPhase Capital portfolio company investment status current

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Empower Community Care is currently a portfolio company of NexPhase Capital; NexPhase acquired Empower on July 16, 2025, from Northlane Capital Partners.[1][5]

Key details
- Acquisition date and parties: NexPhase Capital announced it acquired Empower Community Care on July 16, 2025; terms were not disclosed.[1][3] Northlane Capital Partners confirmed it sold Empower to NexPhase the same day.[5]  
- Advisory: TripleTree advised Empower on its sale to NexPhase in July 2025.[4]  
- Prior owner: Northlane Capital Partners had been Empower’s capital partner since 2021 before exiting in 2025.[3][5]  
- Company snapshot: Founded in 2016, Empower is a behavioral health enablement platform providing evidence-based programs, training, consulting, and software to public systems and providers, serving 2,000+ customers across all 50 U.S. states and 35+ countries.[1][3]  
- Rationale/context: NexPhase characterized Empower as a differentiated, clinically validated platform supporting cost-effective alternatives to institutional care, aligning with private equity’s continued focus on behavioral health and adjacent services.[3]  

Bottom line: Empower Community Care’s current investment status is “owned by NexPhase Capital” following the July 2025 acquisition from Northlane Capital Partners.[1][5]

Sources:

content.text: Let me search for information about Insurance Systems Inc and its relationship with NexPhase Capital.

input.query: Insurance Systems Inc NexPhase Capital portfolio company investment acquisition exit

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "NexPhase Capital made a new platform investment in Insurance Systems Inc. (ISI) on June 6, 2024; no exit has been announced. The deal terms were not disclosed.[1]

Key details
- What ISI does: ISI is a Toronto-based provider of enterprise software for property & casualty insurers; its flagship product, ISI Enterprise, supports the full policy lifecycle including policy administration, claims, billing, accounting, and reinsurance.[1]
- Investment rationale: NexPhase said its capital will support growth in existing markets, expansion into adjacent markets, and product improvements aimed at more integrations, faster implementations, and enhanced analytics.[1][3]
- Advisors on the deal: Choate Hall & Stewart and Gowling WLG served as legal counsel to NexPhase; Morgan Partners was financial adviser to ISI, and Blaney McMurtry served as ISI’s legal counsel.[2]
- Confirmation and date: The investment was announced June 6, 2024, and is listed on NexPhase’s news page as an active portfolio announcement; there is no corresponding exit announcement.[4]

What’s not disclosed or confirmed
- Deal structure and size: Not disclosed by the parties.[1]
- Any acquisition by ISI or add-on M&A tied to this transaction: Not announced in the cited materials.[1][4]
- Exit: No exit has been reported; NexPhase continues to list the investment among its news items with no sale/update indicating a realization.[4]

Sources
- NexPhase Capital press release announcing the ISI investment (June 6, 2024).[1]
- S&P Global Market Intelligence Deal Wrap noting advisors and confirming the investment (June 6, 2024).[2]
- Gowling WLG client-work note confirming its role as Canadian counsel to NexPhase.[3]
- NexPhase Capital news page listing the ISI investment.[4]

Sources:
1. https://www.nexphase.com/nexphase-capital-announces-investment-in-insurance-systems-inc/
2. https://www.spglobal.com/market-intelligence/en/news-insights/articles/2024/6/deal-wrap-shore-exits-behavioral-innovations-serent-sells-shr-81995932
3. https://gowlingwlg.com/en/insights-resources/client-work/2024/nexphase-capital-announces-investment
4. https://www.nexphase.com/news/
5. https://www.morganpartners.com/transaction/morgan-partners-advises-insurance-systems-inc-on-its-investment-from-nexphase-capital/


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}
